TERMS OF PAYMENT

By signing below, you acknowledge that: (1) You have read the entire Contract; (2) You agree to all of the provisions of this Contract; (3) You have received a complete copy of this Contract; (4) The above prices, specifications and conditions are satisfactory and are hereby accepted. Jan Fence, Inc. is authorized to do the work as specified. Payment will be made as outlined above; (5) Until this Contract is paid in full, you have no ownership interest in the fence/material installed on your property; (6) You may cancel this Contract at any time before midnight of the third business day after receiving a copy of this Contract. If you wish to cancel this Contract, you must either (a) send a signed and dated written notice of cancellation by registered mail, return receipt requested; or (b) personally deliver a signed and dated written notice of cancellation to: Jan Fence, Inc., 4 Industrial Road, Pequannock, NJ 07440, Telephone (973) 694-4055. If you cancel this Contract within the three-day period, you are entitled to a full refund of your money. Refunds must be made within 30 days of the Contractor's receipt of the cancellation notice.

Jan Fence, Inc. warrants only to the original purchaser that all new fencing is free from defects in material and workmanship, under normal and proper usage. This warranty only applies to defects resulting from normal use and not from changes caused by alteration, abuse, fire, flood, unstable soil, underground water conditions, checking, warping and Acts of God. Under this warranty, obligation is limited to replacement of the defective material this warranty gives you specific legal rights and you may also have other rights which may vary from state to state.

1. Charges for Late Payment. If we do not receive full payment within 10 days after it is due, you will be responsible for a late payment charge of 5% of the unpaid amount or $10, whichever is greater.
2. Change in Address. You must notify us in writing within 30 days of any change in your address.
3. Official Fees, Taxes and Fines. You must promptly pay all official fees and taxes, if applicable, related to this installation, including permit and inspection fees and personal property taxes. Some bills for official fees and taxes may be sent to you for payment. Other bills may be paid by us on your behalf and we will charge you the amount paid. You must pay all fees incurred during the installation, even if they are assessed and billed after the installation has ended. We may charge you an estimated amount for the remaining fees at the end of the installation. You are responsible for any shortage in this estimate, and we will refund you any excess.
4. Installation. We shall furnish and install a fence as agreed up previously and any additional work as described herein at the address listed on the reverse. We agree to complete coverage, except in omitted areas. We shall be permitted to make all necessary alterations that are in its judgement required to accomplish the work to be performed. We will make every effort to avoid damage to lawn, shrubs and property, but by reason of the nature of the work are not responsible for any damage caused during installation.
5. Completion Date. We shall make a good faith effort to complete the installation on or about the date mentioned herein.
If completion fate in not met by us, we shall not be held responsible for any delay or damage to landscaping or grass.
6. Boundaries. You will provide an accurate survey or diagram of property boundaries upon which we may rely.
7. Permits. You will obtain the necessary permits and variances required.
8. Indemnification. You shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Jan Fence, its employees, officers, directors, and affiliates from any loss, cost, expense, or damage claimed by third parties for property damage and/or bodily injury, including death, which arises from or is related to the installation, use, maintenance or operation of the fence system and/or any work performed by Jan Fence to the greatest extent permitted by law. This indemnification includes claims arising from the location of the fence.
9. Limitation of Liability. You shall in no manner hold Jan Fence, its employees, officers, directors, and affiliates liable for bodily injury or property damages resulting from and/or inflicted to underground pipes, wires, cables, invisible dog fences, pool lines or any other underground structure that is not clearly marked on a survey or diagram of location to scale, or for the improper placement of the fence. Furthermore, we shall not be responsible for empty ground space due to rocky conditions, or heavily sloped areas. You are responsible for all repairs of any damage outlined within this paragraph and for all property boundaries.
10. Notices. All correspondence and notices will be sent to the billing address shown on the Contract, unless you give us a different address in writing.
11.Choice of Law and Severability. You agree that the law of the state of New Jersey applies to this Contract. If certain provisions of this Contract violate the law, those provisions will be void, and the rest of the Contract will be enforceable. The venue of any litigation under this agreement shall be in a court of competent jurisdiction in the State of New Jersey.
12. No Waiver by Us. If we delay or refrain from exercising our rights under this Contract, we do not lose those rights. If we accept late or partial payments from you, we do not waive our right to receive full and timely payments.
13. Modification or Amendment. No amendment, change or modification of this Contract shall be valid unless in writing signed by the parties hereto.
14. Miscellaneous. All material is guaranteed to be as specified. All work to be completed in a workmanlike manner according to standard practices. Any alteration or deviation from the within specifications involving extra costs will be done only upon written change order. The costs will become an extra charge over and above the estimate. All elements of this agreement are contingent upon strikes, accidents, or delays beyond our control. The estimate does not include material price increases or additional labor and materials which may be required should unforeseen problems arise after the work has commenced.
15. NJ Department of Consumer Affairs Consumer Service Center Hotline. (973) 504-6200, Toll free (NJ Only): (800) 242-5846.
16. Insurance. A copy of the certificate of commercial general liability insurance can be obtained upon request. The telephone number of the insurance company issuing the certificate is (973) 256-7703.

h3.strong: Underground Acknowledgement and Release from Liability - Private Utility Lines

div.p:
Public Utilities
Fence installation requiring excavation presents unique challenges in that underground obstructions cannot be seen without commencing digging. In accordance with New Jersey State Law, Jan Fence, Inc will have public utilities marked by NJ-One Call and will not begin digging until marking is complete. We will maintain appropriate clearance from NJ-One Call markings and will follow all other guidelines and rules pertaining to working near these public utilities.
Private Utilities
Private utilities may include electrical lines for outdoor lighting, power to a back garage shed, natural gas or underground piping to a garage or out building, propane lines to gas grills and pool heaters, private water systems, septic systems, drain lines from downspouts, underground sprinkler systems, electric lines installed after the meter, invisible pet fences, data communications line, etc..
Review the Location of Your Private Lines
It is important to review where your private utilities are located. We recommend having private utilities marked. Private utilities in the way of the fence line, either marked or unmarked, impede with your installation.
Turn Off Your Private Utilities
It is recommended that you turn off your private utilities the day of installation. We will only need access to Water and Electricity.
Options for Private Utilities in the way of the Fence Line
Because we are digging into your yard, any private utility in the way of the fence line may be hit during installation. To avoid damage to the utility, we recommend having the utility relocated out of the fence line. This should be completed prior to your installation to avoid delays in scheduling.
NOTE: Jan fence, Inc will use any and all precautions before we dig. Due to the unique challenges in that underground utilities cannot be seen without digging. Jan Fence, Inc is not liable for any damages to private utilities, marked or unmarked as they should to be moved prior to installation.
Our goal is to protect your property from damage and keep our crew members safe.
